explains: adj. 难吃的；没有香味的；令人讨厌的；可耻的，不道德的（同 unsavoury）

sentences.en: Employers and landlords are now using credit checks to filter out candidates and unsavory tenants.
sentences.cn: 现在雇主和房东都通过信用历史来挑选求职者与房客。

sentences.en: The smallish birds have an unsavory habit: they dive-bomb intruders and defecate on them as a defense.
sentences.cn: 小白额燕鸥是世界上最小的燕鸥，它们有一种名声不太好的习性：它们会俯冲轰炸入侵者，并向入侵者排放粪便以作为防卫。

sentences.en: In Asian men, however, many Americans are more likely to see the mark of an unsavory, untrustworthy alien.
sentences.cn: 可这要换了亚洲男性，很多美国人更有可能认为这是一个声名狼藉，靠不住的异乡客的标志。
